item.title: Buckets Method
item.description: The Buckets method is a variation of what’s called “Envelope Budgeting”—the idea of cashing your paycheck and dividing the money into envelopes. You could do this with physical envelopes or the Buckets app. Imagine you have a rain barrel catching all your income that you then divvy out to fill up smaller buckets. Each bucket is different and the fill line varies. You want to make a bucket for all of the expenses you have.

item.title: Principles
item.description: Here are some guiding principles to help you budget well. If you want to jump into how to set up your budget, jump to Buckets Method. 1. Live on last month’s income Spend this month what you earned last month. If you’re not able to do it yet, make it a goal. You really can do it—Buckets can help you! When you start living on a month’s supply of income, start saving to have a “spare month’s supply” of income.
